get.description: Stream real-time trades for a given stock ticker symbol.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a stock ticker or use * to subscribe to all stock tickers.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple stock tickers.
You can retrieve available stock tickers from our [Stock Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/stocks/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a trade event.

sym.description: The ticker symbol for the given stock.

x.description: The exchange ID. See Exchanges for Polygon.io's mapping of exchange IDs.

s.description: The trade size.

c.description: The trade conditions. See Conditions and Indicators" for Polygon.io's trade conditions glossary.

q.description:
The sequence number represents the sequence in which message events happened.
These are increasing and unique per ticker symbol, but will not always be
sequential (e.g., 1, 2, 6, 9, 10, 11).

get.description: Stream real-time quotes for a given stock ticker symbol.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a stock ticker or use * to subscribe to all stock tickers.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple stock tickers.
You can retrieve available stock tickers from our [Stock Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/stocks/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a quote event.

sym.description: The ticker symbol for the given stock.

bs.description: The bid size. This represents the number of round lot orders at the given bid price. The normal round lot size is 100 shares. A bid size of 2 means there are 200 shares for purchase at the given bid price.

as.description: The ask size. This represents the number of round lot orders at the given ask price. The normal round lot size is 100 shares. An ask size of 2 means there are 200 shares available to purchase at the given ask price.

c.description: The condition.

get.description: Stream real-time second aggregates for a given stock ticker symbol.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a stock ticker or use * to subscribe to all stock tickers.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple stock tickers.
You can retrieve available stock tickers from our [Stock Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/stocks/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a second aggregate event.

sym.description: The ticker symbol for the given stock.

vw.description: The tick's volume weighted average price.

o.description: The opening tick price for this aggregate window.

c.description: The closing tick price for this aggregate window.

h.description: The highest tick price for this aggregate window.

l.description: The lowest tick price for this aggregate window.

z.description: The average trade size for this aggregate window.

s.description: The timestamp of the starting tick for this aggregate window in Unix Milliseconds.

e.description: The timestamp of the ending tick for this aggregate window in Unix Milliseconds.

get.description: Stream real-time minute aggregates for a given stock ticker symbol.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a stock ticker or use * to subscribe to all stock tickers.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple stock tickers.
You can retrieve available stock tickers from our [Stock Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/stocks/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a minute aggregate event.

sym.description: The ticker symbol for the given stock.

vw.description: The tick's volume weighted average price.

o.description: The opening tick price for this aggregate window.

c.description: The closing tick price for this aggregate window.

h.description: The highest tick price for this aggregate window.

l.description: The lowest tick price for this aggregate window.

z.description: The average trade size for this aggregate window.

s.description: The timestamp of the starting tick for this aggregate window in Unix Milliseconds.

e.description: The timestamp of the ending tick for this aggregate window in Unix Milliseconds.

get.description: Stream real-time LULD events for a given stock ticker symbol.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a stock ticker or use * to subscribe to all stock tickers.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple stock tickers.
You can retrieve available stock tickers from our [Stock Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/stocks/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a LULD event.

T.description: The ticker symbol for the given stock.

q.description:
The sequence number represents the sequence in which message events happened.
These are increasing and unique per ticker symbol, but will not always be
sequential (e.g., 1, 2, 6, 9, 10, 11).

get.description: Stream real-time imbalance events for a given stock ticker symbol.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a stock ticker or use * to subscribe to all stock tickers.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple stock tickers.
You can retrieve available stock tickers from our [Stock Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/stocks/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for an imbalance event.

T.description: The ticker symbol for the given stock.

at.description:
The time that the auction is planned to take place in the format (hour x 100) + minutes in Eastern Standard Time, 
for example 930 would be 9:30 am EST, and 1600 would be 4:00 pm EST.

a.description:
The auction type.
`O` - Early Opening Auction (non-NYSE only)
`M` - Core Opening Auction
`H` - Reopening Auction (Halt Resume)
`C` - Closing Auction
`P` - Extreme Closing Imbalance (NYSE only)
`R` - Regulatory Closing Imbalance (NYSE only)

x.description: The exchange ID. See Exchanges for Polygon.io's mapping of exchange IDs.

get.description: Stream real-time trades for a given option contract.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify an option contract or use * to subscribe to all option contracts.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple option contracts.
You can retrieve active options contracts from our [Options Contracts API](https://polygon.io/docs/options/get_v3_reference_options_contracts).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a trade event.

sym.description: The ticker symbol for the given option contract.

x.description: The exchange ID. See Exchanges for Polygon.io's mapping of exchange IDs.

s.description: The trade size.

c.description: The trade conditions

q.description: The sequence number represents the sequence in which trade events happened. These are increasing and unique per ticker symbol, but will not always be sequential (e.g., 1, 2, 6, 9, 10, 11).

get.description: Stream real-time quotes for a given option contract.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify an option contract. You're only allowed to subscribe to 1,000 option contracts per connection.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple option contracts.
You can retrieve active options contracts from our [Options Contracts API](https://polygon.io/docs/options/get_v3_reference_options_contracts).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a trade event.

sym.description: The ticker symbol for the given option contract.

bx.description: The bid exchange ID. See Exchanges for Polygon.io's mapping of exchange IDs.

ax.description: The ask exchange ID. See Exchanges for Polygon.io's mapping of exchange IDs.

q.description: The sequence number represents the sequence in which trade events happened. These are increasing and unique per ticker symbol, but will not always be sequential (e.g., 1, 2, 6, 9, 10, 11).

You can retrieve active options contracts from our [Options Contracts API](https://polygon.io/docs/options/get_v3_reference_options_contracts).

sym.description: The ticker symbol for the given option contract.

vw.description: The tick's volume weighted average price.

o.description: The opening tick price for this aggregate window.

c.description: The closing tick price for this aggregate window.

get.description: Stream real-time forex quotes for a given forex pair.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a forex pair in the format {from}/{to} or use * to subscribe to all forex pairs.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple forex pairs.
You can retrieve active forex tickers from our [Forex Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/forex/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a forex quote event.

x.description: The exchange ID. See Exchanges for Polygon.io's mapping of exchange IDs.

get.description: Stream real-time per-minute forex aggregates for a given forex pair.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a forex pair in the format {from}/{to} or use * to subscribe to all forex pairs.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple forex pairs.
You can retrieve active forex tickers from our [Forex Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/forex/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a forex per-minute aggregate event.

o.description: The open price for this aggregate window.

c.description: The close price for this aggregate window.

h.description: The high price for this aggregate window.

l.description: The low price for this aggregate window.

v.description: The volume of trades during this aggregate window.

s.description: The start time for this aggregate window in Unix Milliseconds.

e.description: The end time for this aggregate window in Unix Milliseconds.

get.description: Stream real-time crypto trades for a given crypto pair.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a crypto pair in the format {from}-{to} or use * to subscribe to all crypto pairs.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple crypto pairs.
You can retrieve active crypto tickers from our [Crypto Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/crypto/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a crypto trade event.

s.description: The size.

c.description:
The conditions.
0 (or empty array): empty
1: sellside
2: buyside

x.description: The crypto exchange ID. See Exchanges for a list of exchanges and their IDs.

r.description: The timestamp that the tick was received by Polygon.

get.description: Stream real-time crypto quotes for a given crypto pair.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a crypto pair in the format {from}-{to} or use * to subscribe to all crypto pairs.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple crypto pairs.
You can retrieve active crypto tickers from our [Crypto Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/crypto/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a crypto quote event.

x.description: The crypto exchange ID. See Exchanges for a list of exchanges and their IDs.

r.description: The timestamp that the tick was received by Polygon.

get.description: Stream real-time level 2 book data for a given crypto pair.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a crypto pair in the format {from}-{to} or use * to subscribe to all crypto pairs.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple crypto pairs.
You can retrieve active crypto tickers from our [Crypto Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/crypto/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a crypto level 2 book event.

b.description: An array of bid prices with a maximum depth of 100.

items.description: An array where the first item is bid price and the second item is size.

a.description: An array of ask prices with a maximum depth of 100.

items.description: An array where the first item is ask price and the second item is size.

x.description: The crypto exchange ID. See Exchanges for a list of exchanges and their IDs.

r.description: The timestamp that the tick was received by Polygon.

get.description: Stream real-time per-minute crypto aggregates for a given crypto pair.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a crypto pair in the format {from}-{to} or use * to subscribe to all crypto pairs.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple crypto pairs.
You can retrieve active crypto tickers from our [Crypto Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/crypto/get_v3_reference_tickers).

200.description: The WebSocket message for a crypto per-minute aggregate event.

o.description: The open price for this aggregate window.

c.description: The close price for this aggregate window.

h.description: The high price for this aggregate window.

l.description: The low price for this aggregate window.

v.description: The volume of trades during this aggregate window.

s.description: The start time for this aggregate window in Unix Milliseconds.

e.description: The end time for this aggregate window in Unix Milliseconds.

z.description: The average trade size for this aggregate window.

ev.description: A constant denoting that this message describes a status event.

message.description: The descriptive message explaining this status event.

ev.description: A constant denoting that this message describes a status event.

message.description: The descriptive message explaining this status event.

status.description: The status indicating that the connection event was successful.

ev.description: A constant denoting that this message describes a status event.

message.description: The descriptive message explaining this status event.

status.description: The event that caused the WebSocket to disconnect.

ev.description: A constant denoting that this message describes a status event.

message.description: The descriptive message explaining this status event.

status.description: The result of the authentication action.

ev.description: A constant denoting that this message describes a status event.

message.description: The descriptive message explaining this status event.

status.description: The result of a subscribe action.

ev.description: A constant denoting that this message describes a status event.

message.description: The descriptive message explaining this status event.

status.description: The result of an unsubscribe action.

AggsOpen.description: The open price for this aggregate window.

AggsClose.description: The close price for this aggregate window.

AggsHigh.description: The high price for this aggregate window.

AggsLow.description: The low price for this aggregate window.

AggsVolume.description: The volume of trades during this aggregate window.

AggsStartTime.description: The start time for this aggregate window in Unix Milliseconds.

AggsEndTime.description: The end time for this aggregate window in Unix Milliseconds.

StocksTickerParam.name: ticker
StocksTickerParam.description:
Specify a stock ticker or use * to subscribe to all stock tickers.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple stock tickers.
You can retrieve available stock tickers from our [Stock Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/stocks/get_v3_reference_tickers).

OptionsTickerParam.name: ticker
OptionsTickerParam.description:
Specify an option contract or use * to subscribe to all option contracts.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple option contracts.
You can retrieve active options contracts from our [Options Contracts API](https://polygon.io/docs/options/get_v3_reference_options_contracts).

OptionsTickerWithoutWildcardParam.name: ticker
OptionsTickerWithoutWildcardParam.description:
Specify an option contract. You're only allowed to subscribe to 1,000 option contracts per connection.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple option contracts.
You can retrieve active options contracts from our [Options Contracts API](https://polygon.io/docs/options/get_v3_reference_options_contracts).

ForexTickerParam.name: ticker
ForexTickerParam.description:
Specify a forex pair in the format {from}/{to} or use * to subscribe to all forex pairs.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple forex pairs.
You can retrieve active forex tickers from our [Forex Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/forex/get_v3_reference_tickers).

CryptoTickerParam.name: ticker
CryptoTickerParam.description:
Specify a crypto pair in the format {from}-{to} or use * to subscribe to all crypto pairs.
You can also use a comma separated list to subscribe to multiple crypto pairs.
You can retrieve active crypto tickers from our [Crypto Tickers API](https://polygon.io/docs/crypto/get_v3_reference_tickers).
